oooh i like ben grout's idea

How about a wizard like villager who moves around with levitation potions of some kind. Maybe slow fall and levitation potions are everywhere so that the villager can fly around. Ice spikes could look like ancient-futuristic places. Great idea!
COOL!!!!

The dungeon should have a mini boss like said an ice giant/ yeti or an ice serpent/dragon/lizard.
The yeti being a slightly beefier iron golem and the supplement mob being something like the vex that moves slower and causes slow the reptile mini boss would either have a baby variant or strays as the supplement
The dungeon itself should have the same spire type design to help it blend with the landscape and maybe introduce a colored ice block or something like permafrost and dry ice
It could be a frozen Ocean monument, in which case, we may see frozen zombies and a new variation of the conduit that works in ice rather than water.

And what if we rebuild the kingdom so that villager can live there and they would say we are the king than we have a new effect: named king of living 

Our skin will have a crown and we have a little or big Castel
Maybe by restoring the village you could cause villagers to spawn in it and have a permanent or long lasting hero of the village effect there
Like fallen kingdom
What if these kingdoms where already built and in great condition while others are ruined and have a book explaining what happened in the kingdom.

Thanks for your contribution.
Having Illagers in a caste wouldn't make sense. They are more civilized people and prefer to live in rich classic buildings such as the mansion.
Why wouldn't it make sense? A castle is the home of a king, a impenetrable (until you get there) fortress, why wouldn't a 'higher' pillager want to live in such a thing?
I'm just giving my best opinion about what Illagers would build. Castles to me at least just don't fit.
They should be in almost all biomes and it should be heavily guarded and have traps hidden around. Remember this is the pillagers main bace
i would love to see a pillager castle because then you have an actual army to fight instead of little groups im on for a new adventure
i would love to see a pillager castle because then you have an actual army to fight instead of little groups im on for a new adventure

this is basically announce the deep dark city or the lost city is known announce u sir predicted the feuture
Nice idea man

Great idea, here is my suggestions: 

  • the working mineshaft should add a new profession to villagers, they would have mine carts as their profession block.
  • the entrance of the mine would be about 10 blocks away from the nearest house and would have mine cart rails leading from the mine itself to the Blacksmith shop.
  • the mineshaft would have the mine cart chests with loot just like the abandoned one, but the loot will be better. 
  • There should not be any spider webs and they should have a more used look.

again great idea Minecraft needs this!
we need this

I love this idea! A friend of mine actually suggested something similar when a group of us were playing Minecraft. I think its a great idea, and it makes sense. Players shouldn't be the only ones mining. I mean, how did the villagers get their emeralds? One of my friend's ideas is that when you trade with mining villagers, you can get tools from them for emeralds, or the other way around.
Or built into mountains in mountain bioms
There should be a cartography table in there
It would be better without the fences and to have a llama as his only protection
This is a simple but practical idea
Yo quiero eso

Seconded. Villages have been in the game for a long time and are a central feature to gameplay, yet they still generate with some truly ugly, broken, often inaccessible terrain. Players have been complaining about it for years, and some really old mods like Muon and Better Villages went some way towards remedying the problem, yet it still hasn't been fixed in the base game. Very frustrating.
what i really don't like about village generation even in classic superflat is that dirt paths gernerate in a horrible hodgepodge the bends look bad and there are places were path should not connect

ever since caves and cliffs if I ever wanted a good livable village (mega important for village based roleplay in survival) I've had to spend half my gametime landscaping, and sure it builds that skill, but bro i just wanna progress past an inventory full of dirt and shovels, without having to give up on villages all together.

 

personally I enjoy the other parts of caves and cliffs, but there should be like- a type of plains biome that's flatter, not entirely flat but smoother than the current one, like you can keep the current one but i think it should called like- hilly plains or something like that
plz vote!!!

e dos melhores tempos jogos

I don't think the name could get better than "under construction" or "unfinished' village.

A great idea, but the problem is that unfinished or under construction means it will get finished and That would mean Mojang would need to make villagers develop their home. Which I don't think is gonna happen anytime soon, maybe 10 years or more, if happening at all..
Just a heads up, I am not suggesting that villagers finish their villages. I think these structures should remain static.

Even creepier and funnier: what if they sometimes really did it in game? By groups of at least two, they would disappear with another random mob between them. That would be a rare event.

Edit: I found here another post about mini biomes in the end, and I think this this idea could merge with mine.
Also, about endermen as aliens visiting our world, see this post (rare end ships in the overworld).
I think they should be stealing cows. After all, the theft of cows by aliens is the most meme theft. you can also sometimes find a cow in a desert well.

I think this is a really cool idea. Imagine all the stuff you would be able to find in these abandoned structure. I'm thinking artifacts, and even new weapons, like spears
Maybe Skulk-vines, Killer bats, or other hostile noise-only mobs could spawn here!

What could also be taken from the Hesperides myth is the grey-scale serphent. This could introduce another mob, maybe more in relatiom to the appearance of the Skulk where a snake-like creature could slither and cause poison or a debuff that insinuates a loud sound to call the Warden or attract the beast to the player.

I suggest the molten caves just be lava filled caved constructed of magma blocks and perhaps new heated stone blocks. I do not think new ores are necessary but perhaps diamonds could be more common for the added risk.
it should be only deep underground and there should be lava monsters which come out of the lava and eat you or something like that
I suggest these caves being primarily made of a new volcanic stone, and magma would generate similarly to ores. Also, instead of having a local water level, these caves could have a local lava level.
I had an idea for this too! I was thinking that magma caves could be found in the nether and would be filled with magma. There would also be lava pools and striders would spawn in the lava pools.
oh how would I love to see intact bastions
Their should also be bastions in HORRIBLE condition and instead of piglins, wither skeletons spawn there

This is a really well thought out idea! If we ever got an end update, this would be a great feature, but maybe instead of phantom spawners, there would be a phantom variant called the Dark phantom that when you hit it, you get the thorns affect or the wither affect for a bit more challenge
The Phantom spawner would make sense since you can use their Membrane to repair elytra. Also, the shulkers in this structure should be dyed black to fit in with the obsidian.
I hope this makes birch forests useful.
This reminds me of the great fairy shrines in breath of the wild, great idea!

I like this idea but the end goal leaves a little to be desired. Most players can get an enchanted golden apple from a loot chest in a dungeon. For me to use this I would have to have more of an incentive. For example what are fairies known for?
A. They are mischievous
B. They use all sorts of magic.
C. they are known to hoard all kinds of treasure.
So how do we transition this in Minecraft? First of all we need two-a-day concept of danger. Don't step in the fairy ring. A ring of white mushrooms text crime. Second if the player achieves three goals a book will appear on the shrine. This book will not just be an enchantment book this would be a book that could contain all enchantments for use and reuse.hanjin being able to activate enchantments just by reading them all from a book. And finally underneath the shrine once the book has been claimed a crystal chest appears containing an elytra and 12 resonating crystals that could be used to craft end portal blocks.
Maybe you can get some type of special crop and flower. Like scallions and lavender.
Maybe it would be a terraced garden in the mountains.

Yes! I need a good reason to travel 1000s of blocks to find this mansion. There should be something super unique and useful there. Totems are not useful enough.

Any unique loot should definitely be magic themed. Perhaps a unique item could give the player a vex that fights for the player. Or some longer lasting potions or sets of magical arrows that otherwise don't see much use in the game.

Another form of loot would be to make them into a farm. Like the witch hut, perhaps the area of the mansion is the only place where evokers spawn naturally. This would give a way to farm totems for those technical players.

I think the Illusioner could be added and given a different unique loot that can be farmed too. Maybe something to help with building? Like an illusion structure block that helps you plan builds? Something like that?
I agree with Martin. As of Village and Pillage, you no longer need a mansion to get a totem, so why bother?
Maybe it could always have all the secret rooms and a new one called the nether room it has an active portal and a like of ancient debris.
I was about to post this today, two years later. We still need this, especially because we can already get emeralds and totems from pillager raids.

You should be able to place wood in the water and it move and float around and you could make a mast and be able to control it like a giant boat which you tent to see at the bottom of the ocean so why not be able to make one
